author: VNExplorer
title: Not learning from mistakes could cost Ja Morant everything
text:
Memphis Grizzlies guard Ja Morant.
Since his return from a second gun-related suspension, Ja Morant has been dazzling. After an eight-month layoff, he hasn‚Äôt missed a beat, helping lead Memphis to four straight wins and claiming Western Conference Player of the Week honors.
After Morant received his 25-game ban in June, he said all the right things. He apologized to the NBA, his teammates and the kids who look up to him. He said he realized how much hurt he has caused. He made a promise to his fans that he was a changed person. He ended his initial statement with this plea: ‚ÄúI hope you‚Äôll give me the chance to prove to you over time I‚Äôm a better man than what I‚Äôve been showing you.‚Äù
But after a game-sealing dunk against New Orleans, Morant may have revealed that he hasn‚Äôt changed at all. Or at least that he has little remorse or regard for his actions. While there is some dispute about what he actually did during his celebration, many people think he was simulating firing guns into the crowd.
Prior to Morant, the most high-profile incident with guns in the NBA involved Gilbert Arenas. In December of 2009, after a dispute concerning about $1,000, Arenas and teammate Javaris Crittenton got into a showdown in the locker room. While the NBA investigated, Arenas seemed to seal his own fate by pointing finger guns during the home introduction in a game shortly afterwards. He was ultimately suspended 50 games.
When originally asked about Morant‚Äôs 25-game suspension, Arenas believed it was too harsh. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs public perception,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúThe public wants him to be stopped. So, now the NBA comes in and says, ‚ÄòAll right, we have to make it look reasonable.‚Äô‚Äù
But, after Morant‚Äôs own gun gestures, what does Arenas think now? He posted the clip below to his X page in response. And although it has no commentary, it seems to imply that Morant needs to be smarter about how he handles himself.
Time will tell if Morant gets it and truly wants to be a better man. But if he doesn‚Äôt learn from his mistakes ‚Äì and from those of others ‚Äì his career in the NBA could end up being painfully short.
Want more articles like this? Follow Yardbarker on MSN to see more of our exclusive NBA content.

author: Yogonet
title: Proponen bloquear las plataformas de apuestas online en las escuelas bonaerenses | Yogonet Latinoam√©rica
text: La diputada bonaerense Bel√©n Malaisi, del bloque Evoluci√≥n Radical, present√≥ un proyecto de ley para que los sitios de apuestas online queden bloqueados en las redes de internet de las escuelas p√∫blicas y privadas de la provincia de Buenos Aires. En su iniciativa, la legisladora propuso modificar el art√≠culo 55 de la Ley de Educaci√≥n bonaerense, para que la Direcci√≥n General de Cultura y Educaci√≥n de la provincia de Buenos Aires ‚Äúse meta de lleno en la lucha contra las apuestas online en las aulas de las escuelas‚Äù, el escenario principal de la actividad lud√≥pata de los j√≥venes. ‚ÄúLa Direcci√≥n General de Cultura y Educaci√≥n instrumentar√° todos los mecanismos a los efectos de bloquear en forma definitiva todos los sitios de apuestas en red de internet en el √°mbito de las escuelas tanto de gesti√≥n p√∫blica como de gesti√≥n privada‚Äù, detall√≥ el texto de la diputada de San Andr√©s de Giles. En ese sentido, Malaisi se√±al√≥ que los casos de ludopat√≠a en las escuelas p√∫blicas y privadas bonaerenses han ido en aumento en el √∫ltimo tiempo, por lo que consider√≥ necesario ‚Äútomar medidas de car√°cter urgente a los efectos de limitar esa pr√°ctica en nuestros j√≥venes‚Äù. ‚ÄúNo se puede negar el uso de la tecnolog√≠a en los procesos de ense√±anza y aprendizaje, el acceso a la informaci√≥n, a tal punto que la Ley de educaci√≥n tiene un cap√≠tulo espec√≠fico sobre la virtualidad. Pero tampoco se pueden negar los peligros que supone para nuestros j√≥venes y ni√±os el acceso a determinadas plataformas o sitios de apuestas en las redes sociales de internet que fomentan la ludopat√≠a o el juego compulsivo‚Äù, afirm√≥. ‚ÄúNuestro compromiso como legisladores es con el pueblo de nuestra provincia, por ese motivo es que el Poder Legislativo puede establecer que la Ley de Educaci√≥n estipule el bloqueo de estos sitios, para que independientemente de quien ocupe el cargo de gobernador sean las instituciones de la Provincia la que lo establezcan‚Äù, a√±adi√≥ la diputada. üìù Present√© un ùó£ùóøùóºùòÜùó≤ùó∞ùòÅùóº ùó±ùó≤ ùóüùó≤ùòÜ para que la Direcci√≥n General de Cultura y Educaci√≥n instrumente todos los mecanismos a efectos de bloquear los sitios de apuestas on line de internet en el √°mbito de las escuelas de gesti√≥n p√∫blica y privada.‚Äî MARIA BELEN MALAISI (@MBELENMALAISI) [#DiputadosBA] [pic.twitter.com/MdEG6PB4KE] [June 4, 2024] Cabe destacar que Malaisi tambi√©n present√≥ hace pocos d√≠as una solicitud para que el Instituto Provincial de Loter√≠a y Casinos (IPLyC) de Buenos Aires informe sobre el porcentaje del presupuesto que destina a las publicidades y el listado de medios de comunicaci√≥n a los que las dirigi√≥. Adem√°s de Malaisi, otros diputados y senadores han presentado distintas iniciativas para regular las apuestas online en el √°mbito de la provincia de Buenos Aires, entre ellas est√° la de Julio Pasqual√≠n , la de Silvina Vaccarezza , la de Agust√≠n M√°spoli y Lorena Mandagar√°n , la de Maricel Etchecoin , la de Laura Clark , la de Abigail G√≥mez, y m√°s recientemente la de Carlos Puglelli .

author: @infobae
title: 60 cr√≠as de unos cocodrilos casi extintos nacen en Camboya - Infobae
text:
CrocodilesCambodiaEndangered and Extinct SpeciesGlobal WarmingGreenhouse Gas EmissionsConservation of ResourcesBiodiversity
La mayor poblaci√≥n de cocodrilos siameses nacida este siglo representa dos d√©cadas de esfuerzos de conservaci√≥n de comunidades locales, organizaciones no gubernamentales y gobierno por una especie al borde de la extinci√≥n.
[Estamos en WhatsApp. Empieza a seguirnos ahora]
Hocicos diminutos y colas largas. Escamas negras y marrones en cuadr√≠cula. Huevos del tama√±o de naranjas que se rompen junto a cr√≠as que gorjean y p√≠an como un coro de pajaritos.
El nacimiento de 60 cocodrilos siameses en libertad el mes pasado fue muy como de Parque Jur√°sico.
Las cr√≠as eran la mayor poblaci√≥n nacida este siglo, lo que representa dos d√©cadas de esfuerzos de conservaci√≥n. Mientras las cr√≠as se deslizaban y contoneaban por su tr√≠o de nidos, sus ojos marm√≥reos parpadeaban ante un nuevo y brillante mundo para una especie que anta√±o estaba casi tan extinguida como los dinosaurios.
"Hay una crisis de biodiversidad en todo el mundo, pero en los tr√≥picos del sudeste asi√°tico es especialmente aguda", afirm√≥ Pablo Sinovas, director nacional del programa de Camboya de Fauna y Flora, el grupo conservacionista que supervisa la recuperaci√≥n. "El hecho de que hayamos podido ayudar a estos cocodrilos a recuperarse y ver este hito en la reproducci√≥n es muy significativo".
Los cocodrilos de Siam fueron catalogados por primera vez como pr√°cticamente extinguidos en estado salvaje en 1992. Aunque exist√≠an poblaciones cautivas en zool√≥gicos y granjas de cocodrilos, d√©cadas de caza furtiva de los animales por sus pieles suaves y cobrizas que se utilizaban en la industria de la moda, junto con la degradaci√≥n del h√°bitat, hab√≠an arrasado la poblaci√≥n salvaje.
En 2000, se registr√≥ una poblaci√≥n muy peque√±a en las remotas monta√±as Cardamomo de Camboya. El pueblo ind√≠gena chong hab√≠a protegido a los cocodrilos, que consideraban sagrados, durante generaciones. La especie es m√°s peque√±a y menos agresiva que su pariente, el cocodrilo de agua salada, y no hay constancia de ataques de estos animales a seres humanos, incluidas las personas que lavan la ropa y los ni√±os que nadan en los r√≠os que los cocodrilos habitan.
Durante las dos √∫ltimas d√©cadas, Fauna y Flora ha trabajado con organismos gubernamentales y la poblaci√≥n local para formalizar la protecci√≥n de las especies mediante un programa que proporciona un modesto estipendio, junto con ropa de trabajo, dispositivos GPS y medios de transporte como kayaks y motocicletas.
"Los miembros de la comunidad que ya protegen los lugares son la clave de que este programa funcione", dijo Sinovas. "En lugar de que venga un grupo de fuera, estamos apoyando lo que ya hay all√≠". En el √∫ltimo recuento, persist√≠a en Camboya una estimaci√≥n muy aproximada de 250 cocodrilos adultos, seg√∫n Fauna y Flora, y entre 500 y 1000 exist√≠an en estado salvaje, seg√∫n la Uni√≥n Internacional para la Conservaci√≥n de la Naturaleza.
Los cocodrilos siameses "son depredadores grandes y carism√°ticos, por lo que fascinan naturalmente a los humanos y tienen importancia cultural", dijo Sinovas, se√±alando que su conservaci√≥n podr√≠a tener efectos domin√≥.
"Si somos capaces de conservar a los cocodrilos siameses, lo que requiere la conservaci√≥n de los humedales que habitan", dijo, "entonces por defecto estamos conservando la biodiversidad que depende de esos humedales".
Pero recuperar una especie es un proceso lento, y la Uni√≥n Internacional para la Conservaci√≥n de la Naturaleza sigue considerando al cocodrilo siam√©s en peligro cr√≠tico. Sinovas espera que el esfuerzo por salvar la mayor poblaci√≥n de estos animales en Camboya sirva de modelo para los grupos m√°s peque√±os que se han encontrado en Laos y Borneo.
Otra parte de ese plan es la cr√≠a en cautividad, y esta primavera, Fauna y Flora celebr√≥ un hito diferente: la mayor liberaci√≥n jam√°s realizada de cocodrilos siameses criados en cautividad, con 50 ejemplares j√≥venes liberados en las monta√±as Cardamomo. Los juveniles y las nuevas cr√≠as tardar√°n aproximadamente una d√©cada en alcanzar la madurez sexual. Entonces, los cient√≠ficos y los habitantes de la zona tendr√°n una idea m√°s clara de las probabilidades de supervivencia y crecimiento de la poblaci√≥n salvaje.
"Son animales muy resistentes", afirm√≥ Iri Gill, responsable de animales de sangre fr√≠a, como serpientes y cocodrilos, del zool√≥gico brit√°nico de Chester. "Si les das la protecci√≥n adecuada, se recuperan".
El tono del tel√©fono de Gill es una grabaci√≥n del gorjeo que hacen las cr√≠as al nacer, una llamada sincronizada para que sus hermanos salgan junto a ellas y su madre las encuentre. Ese primer sonido, dijo, muestra c√≥mo ganan fuerza en n√∫mero.
Austyn Gaffney es una reportera que cubre el clima y miembro de la clase 2024-25 del Times Fellowship, un programa para periodistas al principio de sus carreras. M√°s de Austyn Gaffney

author: In the Spirit | The Rev. Holly S. Brauner
title: In the Spirit: All that's good about Good Friday | Religion | newburyportnews.com
text: What is good about Good Friday? Protestant churches don‚Äôt always do much with Good Friday, at least that has been my experience. Not many of us pause, officially or intentionally, on this day to consider the implications of Christ‚Äôs suffering and death on the cross as described in the New Testament. We might have Maundy Thursday (the day before Good Friday) services where we read and ponder the last words and experiences of the living, suffering Jesus. and then, as is often the case, we skip past Friday to Easter Sunday. But, what about today; what we call ‚ÄúGood‚Äù Friday? What is good about this day when we remember Jesus‚Äô death and await his resurrection as the Christ? Perhaps it is ‚Äúgood‚Äù because through this experience we can see that God suffers with and in and through us. In this way, some scholars suggest that God is in solidarity with our own pain. When Jesus suffered on the cross at the hands of his oppressors, leaders at that time were not open to a different interpretation of God‚Äôs love. And, alongside Jesus, God lived in that pain, God suffered. I‚Äôm not sure, so I invite you to wonder with me. What do you think? For me, today at least, Good Friday invites me to see what we as society do to our fellow humans and ourselves in an effort not to address our own inadequacies. We stay in states of war in the world, or closer to home in families or other relationships. We hurt each other when in fact if we thought it through, we might see that we are only hurting ourselves when we hurt others. No matter how much they might disagree with us, we become less than when we treat others as less than ‚Äì less worthy somehow. God loves us all, and we are called to do the same. Good Friday helps us to remember that we are made to love first; to lead with love, not to hurt or blame or cause harm to others so that we can feel better. Good Friday is good because it helps us get to our best selves when we take the time to see how we have been with others throughout time, particularly with those who somehow pose a perceived threat to us. So, take time now, on this Good Friday, to consider that you were born in grace, into a greater love than you can ever imagine, regardless of your faith practice or no faith practice. and grace abounds. Good Friday invites us to see that God is good, all the time. God hurts when we do; God experiences suffering when we suffer or cause someone else to suffer, intentionally or not. and God celebrates goodness in our imperfect ways we try to love. Today we are reminded and invited to lead with love, just as Jesus did when he sought forgiveness for his oppressors, as the story goes. So, on this Good Friday, forgive as you have been forgiven or forgive first and be freed from what holds you back. Love as you have been loved or love first just as God loves you. Put down the practices, or pain or hurt that no longer serve you. Make room for more love. Sunday will be here soon, a day of renewal and resurrection for your whole person, the one God intended you to be all along. and may God bless you on this journey toward Easter. The Rev. Holly Brauner is pastor of First Congregational Church of Georgetown.

author: Admin
title: 6 Ways Small Businesses Can Use AI to Boost Profits
text:
It‚Äôs no secret that small business owners need all the help they can get when it comes to increasing sales, saving money, and streamlining their daily operations. Recent reports have shown that nearly half of all small businesses have turned to AI to help their businesses run more efficiently. While AI may or may not be for your business, we‚Äôre showcasing six ways small business owners are using AI to boost their bottom line.
1) Keeping Shipping Costs Low
Close to 20% of all US retail sales are based around e-commerce businesses. That means an e-commerce business needs to manage the cost of shipping products to a customer‚Äôs front door. For many businesses in the e-commerce space, shipping logistics can eat into their profit margins. But with AI platforms that use predictive analysis, these business can find the cheapest and most efficient way to mail products to customers, ultimately reducing waste, saving time, and improving profit margins.
2) Analyzing Sales Data
It‚Äôs no secret that running a small business leaves you with precious little time to yourself. And if you do get a day off, do you really want to spend it going over monthly sales reports and writing up an
income statement? AI changes all that. Instead of plugging in numbers weekly or monthly, AI keeps up with sales as they happen, making it easier for you to see how the business is performing on a quarterly, monthly, and even weekly basis.
3) Using Website Chatbots
Chatbots are computer programs that simulate human conversations. You‚Äôve probably interacted with one while shopping online. Chatbots don‚Äôt sleep. Day or night, if a customer has an urgent question they need answered, your website‚Äôs chatbot will be there, ready to assist. In terms of using an AI chatbot as a marketing tool, recent studies have shown that chatbots are three times more successful than emails at converting a website visitor to a customer, and websites that install chatbots have reported sales increases of nearly 60%.
4) Implementing Dynamic Pricing
While retail prices often fluctuate (ex: a gallon of milk might be $4.19 one week, and $3.99 the next), dynamic pricing allows businesses to change the prices of their products in real-time. While dynamic pricing may not be for every type of business (we‚Äôre looking at you
Wendy‚Äôs), AI‚Äôs advanced number-crunching capabilities allow business owners to respond to changing market conditions by adjusting prices up or down accordingly. Hotels and airlines have been using dynamic pricing for decades, but now with AI, this type of pricing is being used by grocery and retail stores, and even e-commerce. AI-set pricing can help business owners keep up with market fluctuations.
5) Create Effective Marketing Content
Creating persuasive content (videos, blogs, and images) for a business takes time, creativity, and most importantly, trained employees. AI marketing content generators free up time and resources to allow business owners and employees to focus on other essential tasks. AI can edit videos, create images of products, write blogs in seconds, and even post to social media. But don‚Äôt fire your marketing team just yet. AI (at least when it comes to content generation) isn‚Äôt 100% reliable. AI generated photos don‚Äôt always look realistic, the video editing isn‚Äôt always precise, and written content is generally easy to spot and not always acurate.
6) Streamlining Recruiting and Hiring
Business booming and you need to hire? AI can do that for you. AI platforms can help small businesses find and attract the best people for the job. Instead of spending your time sifting through mountains of cover letters and online resumes, these programs scan applications for key words, skills, and qualifications. Some AI programs can even decide how well a candidate will align with your company‚Äôs values. The decision on who to hire won‚Äôt be taken out of your hands, but with AI, you‚Äôll be able to more confidently approach the hiring process, and save time doing it.
Should Small Business Owners Use AI?
That‚Äôs really up to you, but small business owners shouldn‚Äôt welcome their AI overlords just yet. AI can be costly, and it shouldn‚Äôt be relied on to replace human oversight and analysis just yet. Whether or not a business would benefit from employing AI solutions is a decision that each business owner needs to make on their own. However, there is little doubt that in many cases, using AI to streamline your business operations can save time, reduce costs, and in some cases boost sales.
AI can save you time and money, and so can Nortwest when you
hire us to start your business. We‚Äôve got everything your business needs in one place, including registered agent service, annual report filings, mail forwarding, website and domain services, and more.
